title: 104_hr524
content: SECTION 1. GRANTING OF COPYRIGHT. Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with exceptions for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. Copyright is granted to Inna Hecker Grade and her successors in the works of Chaim Grade for 50 years from June 26, 1982. The copyright owner has all rights and remedies provided by law, with exceptions for lawful uses made before the enactment of this Act. SEC. 2. WORK SUBJECT TO COPYRIGHT. Chaim Grade's works covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo", "Musarnikes", "Dojrois", "Oyf di Hurves", "Pleitim", "Farvoksene Vegn", "Der Mames Tzavoe", "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern", "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner", "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah", "Hurbin", and "Vilna" with different parts like "Di Shank". Chaim Grade's works in section 1 include titles like "Vilna", "Di Shank", "Der Ger-Tzadik", "Di Hiter fun der Shtot", "Unter di Gevelbte Toyern", "Talmidei-Hahomin in der Lite", "Oyf Mayn Veg Tzu Dir", "Dos Alte Hoyz", "Fun Unter der Erd", and "Yury Goresha". In the curr_chunk, various works by different authors are listed, including "From Beneath the Ground", "The Bachelors", "Wrestling with the Angel", "Chaim Nachman Bialik", "H. Leivik, The Poet of Suffering and Fate", "Itzik Manger, the Poet of Beauty and Play", "Three Yiddish Classics", and "Anski, the Maskil, Revolutionary, and Baal Tshuvah". In the curr_chunk, various works by different authors are listed, including "Anski, der Maskl, Revolutioner un Baal Tshuvah", "Probelmen fun a Yiddishen Shrayber un Problemen fun der Yiddisher Literatur", "Mayn Veg in der Yiddisher Literature", "I.L. Peretz", "Mayn Bagegenish mit Sovetishe Yiddisher Shrayber", "Dray Dramatishe Poemen--`Di Goldene Kayt', `Der Goylem', `Der Dybbuk'", "Dray Hoybt Motiven in Mayn Shaffung", and "Yung Vilna un ir Svivah". In the curr_chunk, various works by different authors are listed, including "Young Vilna and its Milieu", "The Return to Zion", "The Sabbath and the Weekdays in Yiddish Literature", "The Mussarists and the Lithuanian Yeshivas", "The Jewish Way of Life in Eastern Europe and Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov", "Rabbi Israel Salanter and Rabbi Israel Baal`Shem'Tov", "The Talmudic Scholar in Yiddish Literature", and "The Memorial Service at the Grand Synagogue". In the curr_chunk, various works by different authors are listed, including a lecture on "The Song of Songs" as a love song, national hymn, and mystical poem. Various lectures and essays on topics such as Saffed and Mount Miron, the people and landscape of Israel, the uniqueness of Vilna, Jewish life in Vilna before World War II, the new Hebrew literature in Israel, and the survivors are listed in the curr_chunk. The curr_chunk lists various works by Chaim Grade, including essays on topics like Saffed, Mount Miron, Jewish life in Vilna before WWII, and new Hebrew literature in Israel.
